abstract.text: Creates a video composition configured to apply Core Image filters to each video frame of the specified asset.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The asset whose configuration matches the intended use of the video composition.
A block that AVFoundation calls when processing each video frame.
The block takes a single parameter and has no return value:
object representing the frame to be processed.
Apple discourages using this method in iOS 16, tvOS 16, and macOS 13 or later. Create a video composition asynchronously using

To process video frames using Core Image filters—whether for display or export—create a composition with this method. AVFoundation calls your applier block one time for each frame to display (or processed for export) from the asset’s first enabled video track. In that block, you access the video frame and return a filtered result using the provided
property to get the video frame in the form of a
object you can apply filters to. Pass the result of your filters to the
method. (If your filter rendering fails, call the
method if you can’t apply filters).
Creating a composition with this method sets values for the following properties:
value for the asset’s first enabled video track. If the nominal frame rate is zero, AVFoundation uses a default frame rate of 30 fps.
property value a size that encompasses the asset’s first enabled video track, respecting the track’s

abstract.text: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.
An object that models timed audiovisual media.
The frame rate of the track, in frames per second.
The track’s transform preference to apply to its visual content during presentation or processing.
An object that supports using Core Image filters to process an individual video frame in a video composition.
Notifies AVFoundation that you cannot fulfill the image filtering request.
Provides the filtered video frame image to AVFoundation for further processing or display.
An object that describes how to compose video frames at particular points in time.
A time interval for which the video composition should render composed video frames.
Creates a video composition configured to apply Core Image filters to each video frame of the specified asset.
Creates a video composition object configured to present the video tracks of the specified asset.
The scale at which the video composition should render.
The size at which the video composition should render.
Returns a new video composition that’s configured to apply Core Image filters to each video frame of the specified asset.
Returns a new video composition that’s configured to present the video tracks of the specified asset.
A representation of an image to be processed or produced by Core Image filters.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.

inlineContent.text: The asset whose configuration matches the intended use of the video composition.
A block that AVFoundation calls when processing each video frame.
The block takes a single parameter and has no return value:
object representing the frame to be processed.
